titleStmt.title: William Frazure et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette

The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

body.p:
Somerset Ky August 22d. 1865
To His Excelence Thos E Bramlette

Governor of Kentucky the undersigned would respectfully represent that at the July term of the pulaski circuit court. Mr John Oens was fined for retailing Spirits as the Statute provides, and having David Oens and family living in the Same house with him he got Mrs Oens in his absence to draw and retail for him, for which her Husband David Oens was fined at the Same term of Court ten dollars ($10) althoug the proof was ample that he David Oens nor his wife had no intrest whatever in the Spirits Sold or. in the procedes or proffits

Wherefore the undersigned pray your Excelency to remit Said fine of ten -- dollars as we think unjustly assessed against=
Said Oens Mr Oens is a mechanic -- and has ever Conducted himself as a Quiet Orderly Cittizen and moreover is in Such circumstanses that ten dollars and the Cost accruing on these procedings fall pretty heavy on him &c --

Respectfully
William Frazure
W Woodwck
J. M. Perkins
J W Hail
G, W, Parker
E G Wither
J. E. Cosson
J. J. Chesney
John Fitzpatrick

The Said Oens
Pulaski Cir Ct
vs
John Owens
$20,
&
vs
David Owens
$10,
Retailing
Remitted 11 Oct/65
